text: hey guys it's angel some of you had
asked me what I normally cook and eat at
home on a weekly basis so today I'm
going to show you my go-to weeknight
noodle recipe which is a three
ingredient rice noodle and beef stir-fry
now a little background on how I created
this original dish
I was actually cleaning out my fridge
one day and I know we all do that don't
we and I had some leftover hot pot or
sukiyaki be a package of rice noodles
and some baby bok choy so with those
three ingredients I ended up creating a
stir fry that was amazing and I was so
surprised at how delicious this was that
is now my go-to weeknight noodle dish so
today I'm going to show you guys how to
make this it's going to be super easy
and after watching this I want you guys
to recreate this at home first let's
prep our ingredients you'll need one
package of fresh rice noodles and
depending on the brand you'll likely
need to gently separate the noodles into
thin strips for the meat you'll need
almost one pound of thinly sliced beef
also known as sukiyaki or hotpot meat
for the veggies cut and washed three to
four stalks of baby bok choy into
smaller pieces and for the flavors we'll
need to peel and mince five to six
cloves of garlic yes I know that's a lot
of garlic but it'll taste good I promise
finally chops two stalks of green onions
to use as our garnish when you're done
set these aside in individual dishes in
place so it's easier for cooking next
add a bit of oil to your wok and swirl
it around for an even cooking add one
third of the minced garlic saving the
rest for later we're going to cook the
main ingredients separately to prevent
the dish from getting soggy or
overcooked
start by stir frying your rice noodles
and cooking them until slightly browned
when you're done remove them from the
wok and set them aside
next we're going to cook our veggies
stir fry some garlic before adding the
bok choy and a tiny bit of water to help
the cooking process stir fry for about
two minutes or until they've started to
become translucent and remove and set
aside finally it's time to cook our meat
use the remaining garlic and gently toss
and cook with the beef cook the meat
until it's about halfway done then add
back your rice noodles then the baby bok
choy making sure to drain any water
before adding and stir-fry with some
salt and heat everything together for
another minute or until the beef is
cooked to your liking when you're done
serve the noodles on a plate then with
the remaining green onions toss in a
light coating of olive oil and sea salt
top the noodles with this garnish and
finally optional if you like a bit of
spice I love adding Japanese each me
togarashi which is a crushed red pepper
I think it complements this dish and the
flavor so I always like to serve mine
with
so that's how you make my three
ingredient rice noodle and beef stir-fry
now as I mentioned before this is my
go-to weeknight noodle dish because you
can make this in 30 minutes or less or
20 if you're like me and you're kind of
in a hurry sometimes so if you guys like
noodles and you guys like fresh noodles
I challenge you to this week eat in get
the ingredients and try making this
stir-fry at home I hope you guys enjoyed
this video give me thumbs up if you love
rice noodles and I will see you guys
soon bye
